website_summaries.verdict: Kobo strikes gold with the well-designed Aura HD, a premium ebook reader with high-quality edge lighting and a super-sharp display.
pros: Soothing edge lighting for dark rooms
Plenty of storage plus a memory card slot
cons: Thicker and heavier than competing readers, thanks to the larger screen
Hard plastic housing feels a little flimsy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: If you want the freedom of reading epubs, and an excellent quality ereader, this is for you. Amazing e-ink clarity; complete customization of fonts, font size, line-spacing, margins, etc. The back light is flawless and easily adjustable. My only complaint is that if you order your books into collections (Fiction, Autobiography, etc.) there is no way to order the listing of those collections themselves (although you can order the books within the collection). This is such a fine ereader that I'm tempted to buy another in case they stop making them!
customer_reviews.author: T. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Order from manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: This device is not covered under the manufacturer's warranty unless it's purchased from Kobo. If you see an offer from Assurant Solutions regarding an extended warranty, it won't apply. Assurant only offers warranties for things that have an applicable manufacturer's warranty. Aside from that, this is a pretty nice device. It's no Nook Simple Touch in terms of hand-friendliness, but it's a reasonable approximation for having a distinct style and no rubberized grip. The larger screen is very nice to use. It's reasonably responsive, and the light is better than Barnes and Noble ereaders, though not quite as good as Kindles.
customer_reviews.author: dhasenan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to add any content.  Light and good battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I've now had mine for years and wanted to share how happy I am with it. It doesn't lock me into Amazon's DRM store and yet is easy to use, light and had great battery life. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: John Nanninga

customer_reviews.title: excellent ebook reader
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Kobo Aura HD a couple of months ago. This is an excellent choice for everyone looking for a high quality device. The 7inch screen -larger than the usual 6inches in other similar devices- provides a relaxing way of reading. It also comes with a backlight for those how need it. You can also store your own books and organize them in collections. The interface is simple and effective while with the 1GHz proc makes the Aura HD the faster ebook reader.
customer_reviews.author: Myron K.

customer_reviews.title: The Cadillac of ereaders!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say....this is perfection! I have had a lot of ereaders. Kindle Keyboard, Kindle Touch, Kindle Paperwhite 1 & 2, Nook simple touch, Sony T1, and some older readers I won't list. Plus still have the Kobo Mini and Kobo Glo. This Kobo Aura HD is by far the BEST of any of them. The size of the screen, the lighting, the quality of the text, the ease of organization, it is the best of the best. I highly recommend it. It is superior to the Kindle Paperwhite. I hated the Cloud Collections, so returned mine. Also you can't put your own fonts on the Kindle, so that was a deal breaker to me. Kobo is #1!

customer_reviews.title: Great product, well worth the higher price.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Kobo Quality and Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Out of three Kobo Aura HDs, two failed within the warranty period. In both cases, Kobo ultimately claimed that I must have applied heavy pressure to the screen and refused to honor the warranty (in the second case, they first kept insisting that it is a software issue and I am not resetting the device correctly). Neither of the defective units had had any significant pressure applied at any point during its short life span. I have had numerous ereaders, including an old Kindle DX which has travelled extensively, and have never had such problems with one. Kobo has quality problems and the company is unpleasant to deal with when a problem arises. Not worth the trouble. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Bright Star

customer_reviews.title: Quite nice so far!
customer_reviews.text: We have a Nook simple touch, Nook glow, Kindle and a Kobo aura hd in the family already, so when my own Nook glow broke, I chose the Kobo to replace it. The tools are great, being able to customize the glow intensity. The reason I gave it 4 stars... don't laugh... the case is SLICK. I am not kidding. My Nook had a rubber-like case - it was easy to keep hold of, I could set it on the dashboard or seat and it wouldn't slide around, but the Kobo .. no matter how careful I am, it is so slick the slightest movement sends it sliding across the truck.

Light weight, easy to read, can't say enough about this reader. The sleep cover is great ! AMAZING battery life. Love it, that's really about all I can say about it. Thanks, Kobo !

customer_reviews.title: Screen way better than kindle
customer_reviews.text: The higher DPI inarguably makes reading on Aura HD the closest thing to reading on paper. After using Kobo for a little while, I couldn't endure reading on kindle anymore, the text and font are unbearably pixelated. Slightly larger screen size also helps--you don't have to flip pages as often. The added weight is negligible. UI and performance are about the same.
